body_html:
Hi @byronyi,
I found out that the repeated edge_4_global request is actually coming from here.
It's a python thread that reads the global counter for counting and timing process.
Once something is stuck, this thread endlessly continues to read the global counter (4 times in a second).
It didn't related to the stuck issue - once I disabled this thread we indeed saw the runtime was stuck without further log messages (the stuck bug was fixed in #12361).
Sorry for not updating this.

body:
Hi @byronyi,
I found out that the repeated edge_4_global request is actually coming from [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/benchmarks/blob/master/scripts/tf_cnn_benchmarks/tf_cnn_benchmarks.py#L241).
It's a python thread that reads the global counter for counting and timing process.
Once something is stuck, this thread endlessly continues to read the global counter (4 times in a second).
It didn't related to the stuck issue - once I disabled this thread we indeed saw the runtime was stuck without further log messages (the stuck bug was fixed in #12361).
Sorry for not updating this.
